âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ CSS-based anti-bot protection â€¢ Honeypot implementation using empty.gif files and invisible links â€¢ Backend measures image loading order to detect bots
ðŸ“– Summary: CSSWAF is a proof-of-concept anti-bot web application firewall that uses CSS to detect bots by analyzing the loading order of hidden images. It also employs honeypot techniques, such as invisible links and non-loading images, to further identify and block malicious bots. This project is intended for demonstration purposes only and should not be used in production environments.
